gurmukhi: guru prmysru swru n jwxI ]13]
transliteration: Guru Paramaysaru Saaru N Jaanee ?13?
translation: That man (in fact) has not understood the essence of Guru and God.

gurmukhi: 14 aupkwrI krqwr nUM sMBwl

gurmukhi: jIau ipMf dy swijAw sws mws dy ijsY iksY

gurmukhi: vwl dMd mUMh rom rom sws igrwis smwil silsY

gurmukhi: swdI lbY swihbo iqs qUM sMml sOvYN ihsY
transliteration: Saadee Labai Saahibo Tis Toon Sanmal Saivain Hisai.

translation: Put salt of devotion in the flour of life and make it tasteful.

gurmukhi: 15 jwgidAwN jyhI surq qyhI sÍpn ivc
translation: Same consciousness while waking as well as in dreaming

gurmukhi: dyhI ivic n jwpeI nINd BuKu qyh ikQY vsY

translation: Whence idleness, yawning, hiccough, itch, gaping, sighing, snapping and clapping?

gurmukhi: auBy swh aubwsIAwN cutkwrI qwVI suix iksY

translation: Hope, desire, happiness, sorrow, renunciation, enjoyment, suffering , pleasure, etc. are indestructible emotions.

gurmukhi: Awsw mnsw hrKu sogu jogu Bogu duKu suix n ivgsY

translation: Millions of thoughts and worries are there during waking hours

translation: And the same get deeply rooted in mind while one is asleep and dreaming.

gurmukhi: suqw hI brVwNvdw ikrq ivrq ivic js ApjsY

translation: Whatever fame and infamy have been earned by man in his conscious state, he goes on muttering in sleep also.

gurmukhi: iqsnw AMdir Gxw qrsY ]15]

translation: Man controlled by desires, goes on intensely longing and yearning.

gurmukhi: 16 durmqI- aupkwr kIqy bI nhIN sOrdw
translation: Even benevolence does not reclaim the evil person-

translation: Persons keeping company of sadhus and evilmen act according to the wisdom of Guru, gurmat, and illwill respectively.

gurmukhi: iqMn vys jmvwr ivic hoie sMjogu ivjogu muxsY

translation: Man acts according to three states of life (childhood, youth, oldage) subject to safijog, meeting, and vijog, separation.

gurmukhi: shs kubwx n ivsrY isrjxhwru ivswir ivgsY

translation: Thousands of bad habits are not forgotten but the creature, RV feels happy forgetting the Lord.

gurmukhi: pr nwrI pr drbu ihqu pr inMdw prpMc rhsY
transliteration: Par Naaree Par Darabu Haytu Par Nidaa Parapanch Rahasai.
translation: He enjoys in being with other's woman, other's wealth, and other's slander.

gurmukhi: nwm dwn iesnwnu qij kIrqn kQw n swDu prsY

translation: He has renounced rememberance of the Lord's name, charity and ablution and does not go to holy congregation to listen to discourses and kirtan, eulogies of the Lord.

gurmukhi: kuqw cauk cVHweIAY ckI ctix kwrx nsY
transliteration: Koutaa Chaouk Charhhaaeeai Chakee Chatani Kaaran Nasai.
translation: He is like that dog who though placed in a high position, yet runs for licking the flourmills.

gurmukhi: AvguixAwrw gux n srsY ]16]
transliteration: Avagouniaaraa Goun N Sarasai ?16?
translation: Evil person never appreciates values of life.

gurmukhi: 17 Anykqw ivc iek vXwpk hY so cyq
translation: Remember the One pervading the many

gurmukhi: iek vrx bYsMqrY sBsY AMdir krdw fyry

translation: The same one fire resides in variegated objects.

gurmukhi: rUpu AnUp Anyk hoie rMgu surMg su vwNs cMgyry

translation: The fragrance is the same which remains there in the materials of various hues and forms.

gurmukhi: vwNshu auiT aupiT kir jwil krMdw BsmY Fyry

translation: Fire emerges from within the bamboos and bums the whole vegetation to reduce it to ashes.

gurmukhi: rMg ibrMgI gaU vMs AMgu AMgu Dir nwau lvyry

translation: Cows of different colours are given different names. The milkman grazes them all but every cow listening to its name moves towards the caller.

gurmukhi: sdI AwvY nwau suix pwlI cwrY myry qyry
transliteration: Sadee Aavai Naau Souni Paalee Chaarai Mayray Tayray.
translation: Colour of the milk of every cow is the same (white).

gurmukhi: sBnw dw ieku rMgu duD iGA pt BwNfY doK ny hyry

translation: Faults are not seen in ghee and silk i.e. one should not go for classes castes and varieties; only true humanity should be identified.

gurmukhi: icqY AMdir cyqu icqyry ]17]
transliteration: Chitai Andari Chaytu Chitayray ?17?
translation: 0 man, remember the artist of this artistic creation!

gurmukhi: 18 Anykqw ivc iek krqy nUM kIqw nhIN cyqdw
translation: The creature does not remember unity in divesity of the creator

gurmukhi: DrqI pwxI vwsu hY PulI vwsu invws cMgyrI

translation: Earth resides in water and fragrance resides in flowers.

gurmukhi: iql PulwN dy sMig imil piqqu punIqu Pulyl GvyrI

translation: The degraded sesame seed mixing with the essence of flowers becomes sanctified as fragrant scent.

translation: The blind mind even after beholding through the physical eyes, behaves like a creature living in darkness,i,e. man is spiritually blind though he beholds physically.

gurmukhi: iCA ruq bwrh mwh ivic sUrj ieku n GuGU hyrI

translation: In all the six seasons and twelve months, the same one sun operates but the owl does not see it.

gurmukhi: ismrx kUMj iDAwn kCu pQr kIVy irjk svyrI

translation: Remembrance and meditation nurture the offsprings of florican and tortoise and that Lord provides livelihood to the worms of the stones as well.

gurmukhi: krqY no kIqw n icqyrI ]18]

translation: Even then the creature (man) does not remember that Creator.

gurmukhi: 19 mnmuK sdw AMnHy hn
translation: Manmukhs, the mind-oriented, are blind

translation: They pick up demerits and leave out merits; they reject the diamond and prepare the string of stones.

translation: These blind ones are called sujOns, the learned and intelligent ones. Inebrigated with the pride of their wealth they wail and weep.

gurmukhi: kwm kroD ivroD ivic cwry ply Bir Bir DoNdy

translation: Engrossed in lust, anger and antagonism they wash the four corners of their stained sheet.

gurmukhi: pQr pwp n Cutih FoNdy ]19]

translation: They never get liberated from carrying the load of their stony sins.

gurmukhi: 20 mnmuK AMdir nUM Avgux krdw hY
translation: Manmukh returns evil for good done to him

translation: The wicked person returns evil for good done to him.

gurmukhi: 21 ingurw mnmuK v`s nhIN Aw skdw
translation: Man having no Guru is uncontrollable

gurmukhi: kuhY ksweI bkrI lwie lUx sIK mwsu proAw

translation: The butcher slaughters goat and its meats is salted and strung on a skewer.

translation: Laughingly, the goat says while being killed that I have come to this condition only for grazing leaves of akk plant.

gurmukhi: mws Kwn gl CurI dy hwl iqnwVw kauxu AloAw

gurmukhi: pr qn pr Dn inMd kir hoAw dujIBw ibsIAru BoAw

translation: The enjoyer of other's wealth, body and slander becomes a poisonous amphisbaena.

translation: This snake is controlled by the mantra of the Guru but manmukh, devoid of Guru, never listens to the glory of such mantra.

gurmukhi: vyiK n clY AgY toAw ]21]

translation: While moving ahead, he never beholds the pit before him.

gurmukhi: 22 dUjw Bwau Kotw dwau hY
translation: The sense of duality is a wrong bet

gurmukhi: Awip n vM\\\\Y swhurY lokwN mqIN dy smJwey

translation: The wicked girl herself does not go to her father-in-law's house but teaches others how to behave at in -laws' house.

translation: The man walking with lamp in hand stumbles because he is dazzled by its flame.

gurmukhi: hQ kM|xu lY AwrsI AauKw hovY dyiK idKwey

translation: He who tries to see the reflection of his bracelet in a avast;

translation: Mirror worn on the thumb of the same hand can hardly see it or show it to other.

translation: Now if he catches hold of a mirror in one hand and lamp in the other even then he would stumble into a pit.

translation: Double-mindedness is an evil stake which ultimately causes defeat.

gurmukhi: 23 mnmuK AkiRqGn hY
translation: Manmukh is ungrateful

translation: A headstrong non swimmer would drown and die even in the tank of nectar.

translation: Touching the philosopher's stone another stone does not transform into gold nor can it be chiselled into an ornament.

translation: Snake does not shed its poison though it may remain entwined with sandalwood all the eight watches (day and night).

gurmukhi: sMK smuMdhuN sKxw rovY DwhwN mwir suxweI

translation: In spite of living,in the sea, the conch remains empty and hollow and cries bitterly (when blown).

gurmukhi: GuGU suJ n suJeI sUrju joiq n lukY lukweI

translation: Owl beholds nothing while nothing is hidden in sunshine.

gurmukhi: mnmuK vfw AkiRqGn dUjY Bwie suAwie luBweI
transliteration: Manamoukh Vadaa Akritaghanu Doojay Bhaai Suaai Loubhaaee.
translation: Manmukh, the mind-oriented, is very ungrateful and always likes to enjoy the sense of otherness.

gurmukhi: isrjnhwr n iciq vsweI ]23]
transliteration: Sirajanahaar N Chiti Vasaaee ?23?
translation: He never cherishes that creator Lord in his heart.

gurmukhi: 24 ingurw pRwxI burw
translation: Man without Guru is the worst

translation: Better is a daughter than an unworthy son, she atleast would set up another' s home and would not come back (to put her mother to trouble).

gurmukhi: kuDIAhuN sp skwrQw jwau jxyNdI jix jix KweI
transliteration: Dheeahu Sap Sakaaradaa Jaau Janayndee Jani Jani Khaaee.
translation: Than wicked daughter, a female snake is better who eats its progeny at its birth (so that more snakes will not be there to put others to harm).

gurmukhi: mwN fwiex DMn DMn hY kptI puqY Kwie AGweI
transliteration: Maan Daain Dhannu Dhannu Hai Kapatee Poutai Khaai Aghaaee.
translation: Than female snake a witch is better who feels satiated after eating her treacherous son.

gurmukhi: bwmHx gweI Kwie sp PiV gurmMqR pvwie ipVweI

translation: Even a snake, the biter of brahmins and cows, listening to the mantra of the Guru would quietly sit in a basket.

gurmukhi: ingury quil n horu ko isrjxhwrY isriT aupweI

translation: But none is comparable(in wickedness) to a Guruless man in the whole universe created by the Creator.

translation: He never comes to the shelter of his parents or of the Guru.

gurmukhi: 25 ingury dw drSn burw hY

translation: He who comes not in the shelter of the Lord God is incomparable even with millions of persons without Guru.

translation: Even the Guruless people feel shy of seeing the man who talks ill of his Guru.

gurmukhi: sIh sauhwN jwxw Blw nw iqsu bymuK sauhwN jwey

translation: It is better to face a lion than to meet that renegade man.

translation: To deal with a person who turns away from the true Guru is to invite disaster.

translation: To kill such a person is a righteous act. If that cannot be done then one should oneself move away.

translation: Ungrateful person betrays his master and treacherously kills brahmins and cows.

translation: Such renegade is not. equal in value to one trichome.

gurmukhi: 26 juAwrIey dw jnm hwrxw
translation: Wasting the life by the gambler

translation: After many ages comes the turn of assuming the human body.

translation: It is a rare boon to be born in a family of truthful and intelligent people.

gurmukhi: dyih Arog dulMBu hY BwgTu mwq ipqw ihqkwrI

translation: Almost rare to be healthy and to have beneficent and fortunate parents who can take care of the well-being of the child.

gurmukhi: swDU sMig dulMBu hY gurmuiK suKPl Bgiq ipAwrI
transliteration: Saadhu Sangi Dulabhu Hai Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Bhagati Piaaree.
translation: Also rare is the holy congregation and loving devotion, the pleasure fruit of gurrnukhs.

gurmukhi: PwQw mwieAw mhwN jwil pMj dUq jmkwl su BwrI
transliteration: Dhaadaa Maaiaa Mahaan Jaali Panji Doot Jamakaalu Su Bhaaree.
translation: But the Jiv, caught in the web of five evil propensities bears the heavy punishment of Yama, the god of death.

gurmukhi: ijau kir shw vhIr ivic pr hiQ pwsw pauCik swrI
transliteration: Jiu Kari Sahaa Vaheer Vichi Par Hadi Paasaa Paouchhaki Saaree.
translation: The state of  jiv becomes the same as that of a hare caught in a crowd. The dice being in other's hand the whole game goes topsyturvy.

gurmukhi: dUjY Bwie kudwieAV jm jMdwru swr isr mwrI
transliteration: Doojay Bhaai Kudaaiarhi Jam Jandaaru Saar Siri Maaree.
translation: The mace of Yama falls on the head of a jiv who gambles about in duality.

gurmukhi: AwvY jwey BvweIAY Bvjlu AMdir hoie KuAwrI
transliteration: Aavai Jaai Bhavaaeeai Bhavajalu Andari Hoi Khuaaree.
translation: Such a creature entangled in the cycle of the transmigration goes on suffering disgrace in the world-ocean.

gurmukhi: hwrY jnm Amolu juAwrI ]26]
transliteration: Haarai Janamu Amolu Juaaree ?26?
translation: Like a gambler he loses and wastes his precious life.

gurmukhi: 27 caupV dI Kyl vw|U gurmuK pugdy hn
translation: Gurmukhs win as in a game of oblong dice

gurmukhi: iehu jgu caupV Kylu hY Awvw gaux Baujl sYNswry
transliteration: Ihu Jagu Chaouparhi Khaylu Hai Aavaa Gaoun Bhaujal Sainsaaray.
translation: This world is a game of oblong dice and the creatures go on moving in and out of the world-ocean.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK joVw swDsMig pUrw siqgur pwir auqwry
transliteration: Guramoukhi Jorhaa Saadhasangi Pooraa Satigur Paari Outaaray.
translation: Gurmukhs join the association of the holy men and from there the perfect Guru (God) takes them across.

gurmukhi: lg jwie so pug jwie gur prswdI pMj invwry
transliteration: Lagi Jaai So Pougi Jaai Gur Parasaadee Panji Nivaaray.
translation: He who devotes his self to the Guru, becomes acceptable and the Guru dispels away his five evil propensities.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK shij suBwau hY AwphuN burw nw iksY ivcwry
transliteration: Guramoukhi Sahaji Soubhaau Hai Aapahoun Buraa N Kisai Vichaaray.
translation: The gurmukh remains in a state of spiritual calm and he never thinks ill of anybody.

gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilv swvDwn gurmuiK pMQ clY pgu Dwry
transliteration: Sabad Surati Liv Saavadhaan Guramoukhi Pand Chalai Pagu Dhaaray.
translation: Attuning consciousness with the Word, the gurmukhs alertly move with firm feet on the path of the Guru.

gurmukhi: lok vyd guru igAwn miq Bwie Bgiq guru isK ipAwry
transliteration: Lok Vayd Guru Giaan Mati Bhaai Bhagati Guru Sikh Piaaray.
translation: Those Sikhs, dear to the Lord Guru, behave in accordance with morality, religious scriptures and the wisdom of the Guru.

gurmukhi: inj Gir jwie vsY gurduAwry ]27]
transliteration: Nij Ghari Jaai Vasai Guru Duaaray ?27?
translation: Through the means of the Guru, they stabilize in their own self.

gurmukhi: 28 AMnHw AwgU
translation: If a blind becomes a leader

gurmukhi: vwNs sugMiD n hoveI crxodk bwvn bohwey
transliteration: Vaas Sougandhi N Hovaee Charanodak Baavan Bohaaay.
translation: Bamboo does not become fragrant but by the wash of Gum's feet, this also becomes possible.

gurmukhi: kchuN kMcn nw QIAY kchuN kMcn pwrs lwey
transliteration: Kachahu Kanchan N Deeai Kachahoun Kanchan Paaras Laaay.
translation: Glass does not become gold but with the impact of philosopher's stone in the form of Guru, glass also transforms into gold.

gurmukhi: inhPl isMmul jwxIAY APl sPl kir sB Pl pwey
transliteration: Nihaphalu Sinmalu Jaaneeai Aphalu Saphalu Kari Sabh Phalu Paaay.
translation: Silk-cotton tree is supposed to be fruitless but that too (by the grace of Guru) becomes fruitful and gives all sorts of fruits.

gurmukhi: kwauN n hovin aujly kwlI hUM Dauly isir Awey
transliteration: Kaaoun N Hovani Ujalay Kaalee Hoon Dhaulay Siri Aaay.
translation: However, manmukhs like crows never change into white from black even if their black hair become white i.e. they never leave their nature even in old age.

gurmukhi: kwg vMs huie prmhMs inrmolku moqI cuix Kwey
transliteration: Kaagahu Hans Hui Dharam Hansu Niramolaku Motee Chouni Khaaay.
translation: But (by the grace of the Gum) the crow changes into swan and picks up invaluable pearls to eat.

gurmukhi: psU proqhuN dyv kir swDsMgiq guru sbd kmwey
transliteration: Pasoo Paraytahoun Dayv Kari Saadh Sangati Guru Sabadi Kamaaay.
translation: The holy congregation transforming beasts and ghosts into gods, causes them to realize the word of the Guru.

gurmukhi: iqs guru swr n jwqIAw durmiq dUjy Bwie luBwey
transliteration: Tis Guru Saar N Jaateeaa Duramati Doojaa Bhaai Soubhaaay.
translation: Those wicked ones who are engrossed in the sense of duality have not known the glory of the Guru.

gurmukhi: AMnHw AwgU swQ muhwey ]28]
transliteration: Annaa Aagoo Saadu Muhaaay ?28?
translation: If the leader is blind, his companions are bound to be robbed of their belongings.

gurmukhi: 29 inMmRqw au`qm aupdyS
translation: Humility the best teaching

gurmukhi: mY jyhw n AikrqGxu hY iB n hoAw hovixhwrw
transliteration: Mai Jayhaa N Akiratighanu Hai Bhi N Hoaa Hovanihaaraa.
translation: Neither there is, nor there will be an ungrateful person like me.

gurmukhi: mY jyhw n hrwmKoru horu n koeI AvguixAwrw
transliteration: Mai Jayhaa N Haraamakhoru Horu N Koee Avagouniaaraa.
translation: None is there subsisting on evil means and a wicked person like me.

gurmukhi: mY jyhw inMdku n koie guru inMdw isir bjru Bwrw
transliteration: Mai Jayhaa Nidaku N Koi Guru Nidaa Siri Bajaru Bhaaraa.
translation: No slanderer is there like me carrying on his head the heavy stone of the slander of the Guru.

gurmukhi: mY jyhw bymuKu n koie siqguru qy bymuK hiqAwrw
transliteration: Mai Jayhaa Baymoukhu N Koi Satiguru Tay Baymoukh Hatiaaraa.
translation: No one is a savage apostate like me turning away from the Guru.

gurmukhi: mY jyhw ko dust nwih inrvYrY isau vYr ivkwrw
transliteration: Mai Jayhaa Ko Dousat Naahi Niravairai Siu Vair Vikaaraa.
translation: None other is an evil person like me who has enmity with persons having no hostility.

gurmukhi: mY jyhw n ivsws DRoih bgl smwDI mIn Ahwrw
transliteration: Mai Jayhaa N Visaahu Dhrohu Bagal Samaadhee Meen Ahaaraa.
translation: No treacherous person equals me whose trance is like crane's who picks up fish for food.

gurmukhi: bjr lyp n auqrY ipMf Aprcy Aaucir cwrw
transliteration: Bajaru Laypu N Outarai Pindu Aparachay Aouchari Chaaraa.
translation: My body, ignorant of Lord's name, eats inedibles and the layer of stony sins on it cannot be taken off.

gurmukhi: mY jyhw n dubwjrw qij gurmiq durmiq ihqkwrw
transliteration: Mai Jayhaa N Doubaajaraa Taji Guramati Duramati Hitakaaraa.
translation: No bastard is like me who repudiating the wisdom of the Guru has deep attachment with wickedness.

gurmukhi: nwauN murId n sbd vIcwrw ]29]
transliteration: Naau Mureed N Sabadi Veechaaraa ?29?
translation: Though my name is disciple,I have never reflected upon the Word (of the Guru).

gurmukhi: 30 auho hI
translation: Humility the best teaching

gurmukhi: bymuK hovin bymuKwN mY jyhy bymuK muK ifTy
transliteration: Baymoukh Hovani Baymoukhaan Mai Jayhay Baymoukhi Moukhi Ditday.
translation: Seeing the face of an apostate like me, the apostates beome more deep -rooted apostates.

gurmukhi: bjr pwpwN bjr pwp mY jyhy kir vYrI ieTy
transliteration: Bajar Paapaan Bajar Paap Mai Jayhay Kari Vairee Itday.
translation: The worst sins have become my beloved ideals.

gurmukhi: kir kir isTwN bymuKwN AwphuN bury jwx kY isTy
transliteration: Kari Kari Sitdaan Baymoukhaan Aapahoun Buray Jaani Kai Sitday.
translation: Considering them apostates I taunted them (though I am worse than them).

gurmukhi: ilK n skin icqRgupiq sq smuMd smwvn icTy
transliteration: Likh N Sakani Chitr Goupati Sat Samound Samaavani Chitday.
translation: The story of my sins cannot be written even by Yama's scribes because the record of my sins would fill the seven seas.

gurmukhi: icTI hUM qUmwr iliK lK lK iekdUM iek duiDTy
transliteration: Chitdee Hoon Toumaar Likhi Lakh Lakh Ikadoon Ik Dudhitday.
translation: My stories would get multiplied further into lacs each one doubly shameful than the other.

gurmukhi: kir kir swNg huryihAwN huie mskrw sBw siB iTTy
transliteration: Kari Kari Saang Hurayhiaan Hui Masakaraa Sabh Sabhi Ritday.
translation: So much I have mimed others so often that all buffoons feel ashamed before me.

gurmukhi: mYQhuN burw n koie sirTy ]30]
transliteration: Maidahu Buraa N Koee Saritday ?30?
translation: None is worse than me in the whole creation.

gurmukhi: 31 gurU drgwh dw ku`qw
translation: A dog of the Guru's court

gurmukhi: lYlI dI drgwh dw kuqw mjnUM dyiK luBwxw
transliteration: Lailay Dee Daragaah Daa Koutaa Majanoon Daykhi Loubhaanaa.
translation: Beholding the dog of Laild's house, Majana was charmed.

gurmukhi: kuqy dI pYrIN pvY hiV hiV hsY lok ivfwxw
transliteration: Koutay Dee Pairee Pavai Harhi Harhi Hasai Lok Vidaanaa.
translation: He fell at the feet of dog seeing which people laughed roaringly.

gurmukhi: mIrwsI mIrwsIAwN nwm DrIku murId ibbwxw
transliteration: Meeraasee Meeraaseeaan Naam Dhareeku Mureedu Bibaanaa.
translation: Out of (Muslim) bards one bard became disciple of Baia (Nanak).

gurmukhi: kuqw fUm vKwxIAY kuqw ivic kuiqAwN inmwxw
transliteration: Koutaa Doom Vakhaaneeai Koutaa Vichi Koutiaan Nimaanaa.
translation: His companions called him a dog-bard, even among dogs a lowly one.

gurmukhi: gurisK Awsk sbd dy kuqy dw pVkuqw Bwxw
transliteration: Gurasikh Aasaku Sabad Day Koutay Daa Parhakoutaa Bhaanaa.
translation: TheSikhs of the Guru who were suitors of the Word (the Brhm) took a fancy to that so-called dog of dogs.

gurmukhi: ktin ctin kuiqAwN mohu n Dohu DiRgsq kmwxw
transliteration: Katanu Chatanu Koutiaan Mohu N Dhohu Dhrigasatu Kamaanaa.
translation: Biting and licking is the nature of dogs but they have no infatuation, treachery or cursedness.

gurmukhi: AvguixAwry guxu krin gurmuiK swDsMgiq kurbwxw
transliteration: Avagouniaaray Gounu Karani Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Kurabaanaa.
translation: The gurmukhs are sacrifice unto the holy congregation because it is benevolent even to the evil and wicked persons.

gurmukhi: piqq auDwrx ibrdu vKwxw ]31]37]
transliteration: Patit Udhaaranu Biradu Vakhaanaa ?31?37?saintee?
translation: Holy congregation is known for its reputation as uplifter of the fallen ones.

gurmukhi: pUrn bHm gur byl huie cMbylI giq mUl swKw pqR kir ibibD ibQwr hY
transliteration: Pooran Braham Gur Bayl Hui Chanbaylee Gati , Mool Saakhaa Patr Kari Bibidh Bidaar Hai ?
translation: Satguru, manifestation of Almighty God, is like jasmine creeper of which He Himself is the root and all His devotees and pious persons are its leaves and branches.

gurmukhi: gurisK puhp subws inj rUp qw mY pRgt huie krq sMswr ko auDwr hY
transliteration: Gursikh Puhap Soubaas Nij Roop Taa Mai , Pragat Hui Karat Sansaar Ko Udhaar Hai ?
translation: Pleased at the services of His devotees (like Bhai Lehna Ji, Baba Amar Das Ji, etc.) Satguru turns those devotees by His grace and makes them into fragrance-spreading flowers and by manifesting in them is liberating the world.

gurmukhi: iql imil bwsnw subws ko invws kir Awpw Koie hoie hY Pulyl mhkwr hY
transliteration: Til Mili Baasanaa Soubaas Ko Nivaas Kari , Aapaa Khoi Hoi Hai Dhulayl Mahakaar Hai ?
translation: Just as sesame seed loses its existence and becomes scent when unites with the fragrance of the flowers, the devotees too lose themselves to the Lord through meditation and spread divine fragrance in the world.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK mwrg mY piqq punIq rIiq sMswrI huie inrMkwrI praupkwr hY ]37]
transliteration: Gurmukhi Maarag Mai Patit Pouneet Reeti , Sansaaree Hui Nirankaaree Paraoupakaar Hai ?37?
translation: Sikhism has a tradition of changing sinners into holy persons. And in this path, this is a very righteous task and service towards others. Those engrossed in material world are converted into God-loving and godly persons. They are detached from maya (mamm
